cluster_relations.rel_desc: Butterfly species determine variation in the size, shape, and color of eggs.
cluster_relations.canonical_rel_desc: Subject biological taxon determines specific phenotypic traits (e.g., size, shape, color) of the object life stage or structure.
cluster_relations.subject_class_label: Butterfly Life Cycle Organisms and Host Plants

qualifiers.ConditionExpression: egg size, shape, and color depend on the species
qualifiers.OtherQualifier: Traits affected: size, shape, color of eggs

cluster_relations.rel_desc: The time metamorphosis takes varies according to the butterfly species.
cluster_relations.canonical_rel_desc: The temporal duration of the subject process varies as a function of the object factor (e.g., species).
cluster_relations.object_class_label: Butterfly Life Cycle Organisms and Host Plants

qualifiers.TemporalQualifier: anywhere from a few days to several weeks

args.justification: Both relations express that a biological trait or quantitative characteristic (egg phenotype, metamorphosis duration) systematically depends on butterfly species. Refining rel_cls from the generic 'biological_dependency_relation' to 'biological_trait_dependency_relation' better captures that this family of relations encodes species-dependent variation in biological traits, while keeping the existing canonical_rel_name values and the CAUSALITY group unchanged.

executed_decisions.justification: Both relations express that a biological trait or quantitative characteristic (egg phenotype, metamorphosis duration) systematically depends on butterfly species. Refining rel_cls from the generic 'biological_dependency_relation' to 'biological_trait_dependency_relation' better captures that this family of relations encodes species-dependent variation in biological traits, while keeping the existing canonical_rel_name values and the CAUSALITY group unchanged.
